p: A strategy using transgenic mice overexpressing the MERS-CoV receptor hCD26/DPP4 was also needed to replicate the severity of human MERS ( Agrawal et al., 2015). When hCD26/DPP4 mice were infected with moderate loads of MERS-CoV, significant brain damage occurred, mainly localized in the brainstem, where perivascular cuffing, apoptotic bodies, and activated microglia were observed. Conversely, only a mild meningitis occurred in the cortex ( Tao et al., 2016).
